conbody.p: A network control list (ACL) is an additional, optional layer of security that you can define to control traffic in and out of a subnet in your VPC. Unlike security groups, ACLs work at the subnet level.

Unlike rules in a security group, a network ACL contains lists of numbered inbound and outbound rules (starting at 1 and ranging up to 32767) that are evaluated in order to determine whether traffic is allowed on the subnet associated with the ACL.

ul.li: for inbound rules, the range of the source traffic (CIDR) and the port or port range
for outbound rules, the range for the destination traffic (also in CIDR notation) along with the destination port/port range

conbody.p: Your VPC comes with a default network ACL with inbound and outbound rules that allow all traffic in a subnet.
